meanings.definition: To move or transfer (someone or something) to a different place or position.
meanings.sent1: The workers were shunting boxes from the truck to the warehouse.
meanings.sent2: The train shunted the cargo to the loading dock efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy kept shunting his toys under the couch.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts would often shunt to happier times during difficult moments.
meanings.sent5: The students were shunting their attention back and forth between the teacher and the whiteboard.

meanings.definition: The act of diverting or switching a train or railway carriage from one track to another.
meanings.sent1: The shunting of the train was necessary to avoid a collision.
meanings.sent2: The railway workers performed the shunting with precision and skill.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected shunting of the train made the passengers giggle.
meanings.sent4: The shunting of the carriages resembled a carefully choreographed dance.
meanings.sent5: The loud noise of the shunting echoed through the train station.
